SENT.plain: Atrial fibrillation (AF) is the most common sustained cardiac arrhythmia
It places an enormous burden on the patients, caregivers and the society at large
As a chronic illness, AF accrues significant costs related to clinical presentation, complications and loss of productivity
Novel invasive approaches to AF promise a cure in some patients and a significant reduction in AF burden in others, but are very expensive
This paper will address the cost of conventional and invasive strategies in AF care and will review the evidence on the comparative cost effectiveness of these approaches
